definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
lit. a willow that bends with the wind/one with no fixed principles (idiom)
to trim one's sails with the wind/to adopt different attitude depending on the circumstances (idiom)

sentences.english: He spat at the lonely cigarette, misty smoke wind.
sentences.chinese: 他吐着寂寞的烟卷，飘渺的烟雾随风而散。

sentences.english: Danced in the wind that's you.
Fluttering red smile, only for the drunk.
sentences.chinese: 随风飘摇红尘一笑，只为醉逍遥。

sentences.english: He was like a reed moving in wind.
sentences.chinese: 希律王就像一根随风摇曳的芦苇。

sentences.english: And I understand. But boy it's time to let go.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我的男孩，现在是让往事随风而去的时候了。

sentences.english: It is time to let it go.
sentences.chinese: 是时候让一切随风而去了。

sentences.english: Butterfly drunk to spend, spend but the wind to fly.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶为花醉，花却随风飞。

sentences.english: Use this to simulate randomly changing forces on the cloth, such as wind turbulences waving a flag.
sentences.chinese: 用这个来模拟随机大小的力，如随风飘扬的旗帜。

sentences.english: Maybe in her mind he disappeared never ever, although he had gone with the wind.
sentences.chinese: 也许在她心底，他永远不会消失，纵然他已随风而逝。

sentences.english: It floats through the balcony doors and makes the curtains dance.
sentences.chinese: 它穿过阳台的门，吹得窗帘随风飘舞。

sentences.english: The green grass, such as the heart ripple swing with the wind.
sentences.chinese: 岸边的绿草随风摆动，如心儿荡漾。

sentences.english: You who travel with the wind, what weathervane shall direct your course?
sentences.chinese: 你是随风旅行的人，什么风向将会指引你该走了路呢？

sentences.english: Wind-blown cypress pollen is a major cause of allergies in some parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 世界某些地区，随风传送的柏树花粉才是主要过敏源。

sentences.english: When the clouds break months, will offer all kinds of knot wind dispersed in the sea the sky.
sentences.chinese: 当云破月来，千般纠结都将随风弥散在水际云天。

sentences.english: This flexibility allows the statue to sway in the harbor winds.
sentences.chinese: 这使雕像具有能够在港湾中随风摇摆的灵活性。

sentences.english: Wind-driven drops of the autumn rain.

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
